Blog.post: I think i attract loonies because either i am too nice or they think i am one of them. I'm not sure which yet. I'll keep you updated.

Now i understand how to make a blog I can post more blogs and make the looney magnets a place to remember! this old woman looney sounds weird. The thing about old women is that they spend an unusual amount of time at bus stops. This is where the elderly gather to enjoy quality moaning time. However, i think it is unfair to classify all old people as loonies and instead the old loonies will just be the weird women with the son who eats rice (who i would like to meet) and old men who wear string vests. I mean how is a string vest supposed to keep you warm?

yay now thers members n i feel like i have friends!!! Muchly happy. Am trying to think of all the loonies i have met (other than you guys) there are many who think they are my best friends. The pink shoe guy : who wandered round behind me, rachel and maz in stratford, mumbling something along the lines of "mmm...pink shoes, pink shoes, pinks shoes rule, evryone should wear pink shoes, i like pink shoes, all women...pink shoes"etc etc etc-admittedly it was rachel who was wearing the pink shoes so im happy to know that he thinks that she's his best friend and not me. The looney monk in solihull who keeps trying to convince me to donate money to his monastry in germany or somewhere like that-but he really does think that im his best mate-and i notice he has a lady monk friend but i ignore her when she wants my money. Then theres the mad women who like to talk to me at the bus stop. Oh, and the mad woman who lives near su: within the five minutes it takes to walk from the bus to the house, i found out that shes in her 50s, was brought up by her grandmother, with her two cousins, she doesn't work but finds that housekeeping keeps her busier than any other job would, she has a husband and 17 yr old son who dont appreciate her enough, her son is into sport and shes worried about him cos he only ever wants to eat fish and rice, she doesnt like thunder storms which she thinks is because her grandmother didnt either, when theres a storm she hides in the bathroom, and propbably plenty more-and the worrying thing is that i dont walk that slowly and she didnt talk that fast-i think theres a time warp of some kind involved!!! Thats all i can think of at the mo so... happy looney-searching folks!

yay! being a looney i now have a place where i dont have to hide from the world but can admit my loony ways and be free! hehee this is a guten idea hannah there are bound to be some loonies i can tell you about in Australia! xxxx

have sent an invitation to people to become members-meaning that you can post stuff on the site. If i'v missed you off the list, 1st-sorry and 2nd-let me know so i can add you to the list. Happy posting!!!!
This is the looney bin. As a self-confessed looney magnet, I attract loads of looneys-lemme know bout the loonies you meet on your travels!

Hello people! I feel very honoured to have been invited to such a wonderful place. It will be soooo much easier keeping up with everyone here. Anyway Hannah, on the subject of Looney people, I have a few to add to the list. Some of them are classics like the Freaky Paris Man who tried to get in our photograph (and grope my arse), and the Growling Man on the bus some years ago. Also Nicola might remember the man who preached to us on the number 4 bus about the Bible all the way from Birmingham to our stop. Lastly there is Weird Adam who regularly send texts about how God loves me, and wears white jeans, and crocodile shoes, and reminds of an elf crossed with a line-dancer even though he doesn't really look like either. I will let you know if I think of any more. Until then, happy revising!!!
